text.section:
On rehearing, the Commission may:
consider facts not presented in the original hearing, including facts arising after the date of the original hearing; and
abrogate, change, or modify the original order by new order.

Except as otherwise ordered by the Commission, the rehearing or application for the rehearing does not:
stay the enforcement of an order of the Commission; or
excuse a person affected by the order from complying with the terms of the order.

section.section: A party in interest may apply to the Commission for rehearing within 30 days after service of a final order on the party.

The Commission may:
act on the application; and
rehear a final order or conduct further proceedings on its own motion after the filing of a proposed order, as the Commission considers necessary.
If a rehearing is granted on an application under this subsection, the Commission shall decide the case within 30 days after the case is finally submitted on rehearing.
